protocol_name: Preparation and evaluation of brain-targetd thermosensitive in situ gel of geniposide
protocol_name_html: Preparation and evaluation of brain-targetd thermosensitive in situ gel of geniposide
protocol_affiliation: The First People’s Hospital of Jining
manuscript_citation: Wang Y, Jiang S, Wang H, Bie H (2017) A mucoadhesive, thermoreversible in situ nasal gel of geniposide for neurodegenerative diseases. PLoS ONE 12(12): e0189478. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0189478
keywords: Geniposide, Thermosensitive in situ gel, Central Composite Design-response Surface Methodology,In vitro,Ex vivo

authors_list.name: Yingting Wang
authors_list.affiliation: The First People’s Hospital of Jining

authors_list.affiliation: The First People’s Hospital of Jining

components.data: Determination of geniposide: C18 column (5 μm, 4.6 mm × 250 mm), the mobile phase   acetonitrile: puriﬁed water (15: 85), 238 nm, the column temperature 25℃, the volume of each injection 20 μl.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Determination of geniposide: C18 column (5 μm, 4.6 mm × 250 mm), the mobile phase   acetonitrile: puriﬁed water (15: 85), 238 nm, the column temperature 25℃, the volume of each injection 20 μl.

components.data: Preparation of formulation: 1	Puriﬁed water was stored overnight at 4℃ in refrigerator.  2	Required amount of poloxamers were slowly added into the required volume of cold puriﬁed water with continuous stirring. 3	The upper hydrogel was kept at 4℃ until a transparent hydrogel was obtained.  4	The required amount of hydroxypropyl methylcellulose, benzalkonium chloride, sodium chloride, geniposide and borneol were dispersed into the hydrogel with continuous stirring. Volume was adjusted.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Preparation of formulation: 1	Puriﬁed water was stored overnight at 4℃ in refrigerator.  2	Required amount of poloxamers were slowly added into the required volume of cold puriﬁed water with continuous stirring. 3	The upper hydrogel was kept at 4℃ until a transparent hydrogel was obtained.  4	The required amount of hydroxypropyl methylcellulose, benzalkonium chloride, sodium chloride, geniposide and borneol were dispersed into the hydrogel with continuous stirring. Volume was adjusted.

components.data: Clarity of formulation：Under black and white background, the clarity of formulation was observed and graded.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Clarity of formulation：Under black and white background, the clarity of formulation was observed and graded.

components.data: The pH value of formulation was determined by using the pH meter. The pH meter was first calibrated using solutions of pH 7.01 and pH 4.01.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: The pH value of formulation was determined by using the pH meter. The pH meter was first calibrated using solutions of pH 7.01 and pH 4.01.

components.data: Gelation temperature of formulation:  1 Hydrogel (0.5 ml) was transferred to small (2 ml, 12 mm × 32 mm). 2 Vial was sealed and immersed into a thermostat controlled-electric water bath at an initial temperature of 20℃.  3 Temperature of the water bath was increased in increment of 0.5℃/min.  4 Mercury bulb of a thermometer with a minimum readable scale of 0.2℃ was placed at the same level with the hydrogel.  5 The meniscus of the hydrogel didn’t move when the vial was tilted 90 degree angle. The temperature was identified as the gelation temperature.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Gelation temperature of formulation:  1 Hydrogel (0.5 ml) was transferred to small (2 ml, 12 mm × 32 mm). 2 Vial was sealed and immersed into a thermostat controlled-electric water bath at an initial temperature of 20℃.  3 Temperature of the water bath was increased in increment of 0.5℃/min.  4 Mercury bulb of a thermometer with a minimum readable scale of 0.2℃ was placed at the same level with the hydrogel.  5 The meniscus of the hydrogel didn’t move when the vial was tilted 90 degree angle. The temperature was identified as the gelation temperature.

components.data: The gel strength:  A sample of 50 g of hydrogel was put into a 100 ml graduated cylinder and gelled in a thermostatically controlled water bath at 37±0.5℃.  A weight of 35 g was placed onto the gel. The gel strength was determined by the time in second as the weight  penetrated 5 cm into the gel.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: The gel strength:  A sample of 50 g of hydrogel was put into a 100 ml graduated cylinder and gelled in a thermostatically controlled water bath at 37±0.5℃.  A weight of 35 g was placed onto the gel. The gel strength was determined by the time in second as the weight  penetrated 5 cm into the gel.

components.data: Mucoadhesive strength: 1 A section of fresh goat nasal mucosa was prepared. 2 The goat nasal mucosa was tied to one side of the both vials (2 cm diameter). 3 Fifty milligrams of hydrogel was placed on one nasal mucosa of one vial. The two vials’ nasal mucosa were attached together for 2 min.  4 Water was poured drop by drop into one container of the balance instrument until the two vials got detached from each other.  5 The minimal water was weighed.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Mucoadhesive strength: 1 A section of fresh goat nasal mucosa was prepared. 2 The goat nasal mucosa was tied to one side of the both vials (2 cm diameter). 3 Fifty milligrams of hydrogel was placed on one nasal mucosa of one vial. The two vials’ nasal mucosa were attached together for 2 min.  4 Water was poured drop by drop into one container of the balance instrument until the two vials got detached from each other.  5 The minimal water was weighed.

components.data: In vitro release: 1 Cold hydrogel (5 g) was transferred into a graduated test tube (1 cm diameter) and placed in water bath (34±0.5℃) and maintained 10 min.  2 A saline phosphate buffer (pH=6.4, 2.5 ml, 37±0.5℃) was layered over the surface of the gel.  3 Removed the medium at one-hour interval. 4 Test tube was cleared, weighted and layered with fresh saline phosphate buffer (2.5 ml).
components.name: Section

source_data.section: In vitro release: 1 Cold hydrogel (5 g) was transferred into a graduated test tube (1 cm diameter) and placed in water bath (34±0.5℃) and maintained 10 min.  2 A saline phosphate buffer (pH=6.4, 2.5 ml, 37±0.5℃) was layered over the surface of the gel.  3 Removed the medium at one-hour interval. 4 Test tube was cleared, weighted and layered with fresh saline phosphate buffer (2.5 ml).

components.data: Ex vivo drug permeation: 1 A section of fresh goat nasal mucosa was prepared. 2 The nasal mucosa was ﬁxed on the Franz diffusion cell having effective permeation area of 2.8 cm2.  3 After 30 min of incubation time, gel 0.5 g was placed in the donor compartment.  4 The temperature of the chamber was maintained at 34±0.5℃.  5  Saline phosphate buffer (pH6.4, 6.5 ml)  used as receptor medium was withdrawn from the receptor chamber at 30 min interval, and immediately replaced by the fresh. 6 The geniposide of sample was determined by the high- performance liquid chromatography method.
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Ex vivo drug permeation: 1 A section of fresh goat nasal mucosa was prepared. 2 The nasal mucosa was ﬁxed on the Franz diffusion cell having effective permeation area of 2.8 cm2.  3 After 30 min of incubation time, gel 0.5 g was placed in the donor compartment.  4 The temperature of the chamber was maintained at 34±0.5℃.  5  Saline phosphate buffer (pH6.4, 6.5 ml)  used as receptor medium was withdrawn from the receptor chamber at 30 min interval, and immediately replaced by the fresh. 6 The geniposide of sample was determined by the high- performance liquid chromatography method.
